bestBHT.bht: To the King, the incorruptible and invisible God, be honor and glory for all eternity. God's reign extends over all ages and generations, distinguishing Him as the only eternal King. He alone possesses immortality and is the incorruptible God. Let us praise and admire His infinite wisdom, for He is the source of all grace. The thought of eternity is delightful to those who are assured of God's grace, as they find solace in the everlasting nature of His reign.

Henry Alford: But (this disjunctive particle takes the thought entirely off from himself and every thing else, and makes the following sentence exclusive as applied to God.
to the King (this name, as applied to God, is found, in the New Test., only in Matt. v. 35 [not xxv. 33 ff.] and our ch. vi. 15.

the incorruptible (in Rom. xvi. 27 only used of God), invisible (see ch. vi. 16: John i. 18), only God (the word wise has apparently come from the doxology at the end of Romans, where it is most appropriate), be honour and glory to the ages of the ages (the periods which are made up of. ages, as these last are of years,—as years are of days: see note, Eph. iii. 21).
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The Lord shall reign for ages and beyond them.
It answers also to 'for ever and ever' at the close, literally, 'to the ages of the ages.'
The thought of eternity (terrible as it is to unbelievers) is delightful to those assured of grace.
Albert Barnes: God is called King here, as he is often in the Scriptures, to denote that he rules over the universe...His dominion extends over all ages or generations.
Immortal - This refers to God himself, not to his reign...All other monarchs but God expire - and are just as liable to die at any moment as any other people.
The gods of the pagan are 'vanity and a lie,' and they are wholly destitute of wisdom...Yahweh is the only God; it is also true that he is the only wise God.
Marvin Vincent: The only God [μονω θεω]. The only instance in which Paul applies the term to God.
John Calvin: Yet, at the same time, by his example he reminds us all that we ought never to think of the grace manifested in God’s calling without being carried to lofty admiration.
This sublime praise of the grace which God had bestowed on him swallows up the remembrance of his former life.
He means that the infinite and incomprehensible wisdom of God should be beheld by us with such reverence that, if his works surpass our senses, still we may be restrained by admiration.
Philip Schaff: The King eternal. Literally ‘the king of the ages,’ of all the æons or periods which man’s thought can apprehend in the remotest past, or future."
Immortal. Better, as in Rom 1:23 ; 1 Corinthians 15:52, ‘ incorruptible.’
For ever and ever. Lit. ‘for the ages of the ages,’ periods in which each moment is an æon.
Archibald T. Robertson: For other doxologies see Galatians 1:5; Romans 11:36; Romans 16:27; Philippians 4:20; Ephesians 3:21; 1 Timothy 6:16.
Incorruptible (αφθαρτω). As an epithet of God also in Romans 1:23.
The only God (μονω θεω). So Romans 16:27; John 5:44; John 17:3.
John Gill: He is the everlasting King, or the King of ages, or of worlds; he is Maker of the worlds, and the Governor of them throughout all ages and generations; he only has immortality, and is the incorruptible God, and who is invisible, whose shape has never been seen, nor his voice heard.

And everything here said is applicable to him; he is the eternal King, whose is the kingdom of nature, providence, and grace; his throne is for ever and ever, and of his kingdom and government there is no end; he is the 'King of ages', as the phrase may be rendered, and so his kingdom is called 'the kingdom of all ages', Psalms 145:13 and which endures throughout all generations; and this distinguishes him from all other kings.

Christ is crowned with honour and glory, and he is worthy of it; and it becomes all men to honour the Son, as they do the Father: he is the brightness of his glory, and equal to him; and the glory of deity, of all the divine perfections, and works, and also worship, should be given him; as well as the glory of salvation, and of all the grace the sons of men partake of; and that not only now, but to all eternity.
John Wesley: The King of eternity — A phrase frequent with the Hebrews. How unspeakably sweet is the thought of eternity to believers!

bhtAttempts.bht: To the eternal King, the incorruptible and invisible God, be everlasting honor and glory. He reigns over all ages and generations, far surpassing any earthly kings or rulers. His wisdom and grace are incomprehensible, deserving our utmost reverence and admiration. As the only God, he is the source of immortality and incorruptibility. Let us praise him forever and ever, for he is the King of eternity. The thought of eternity brings delight to believers, who find solace in knowing that God's grace is everlasting.

To the eternal King, the incorruptible and invisible God, be everlasting honor and glory. He reigns over all ages and generations, far surpassing any earthly kings or rulers. His wisdom and grace are incomprehensible, deserving our utmost reverence and admiration. As the only God, he is the source of immortality and incorruptibility. Let us praise him forever and ever, for he is the King of eternity. The thought of eternity brings delight to believers, who find solace in knowing that God's grace is everlasting.

To the King, the incorruptible and invisible God, be honor and glory for all eternity. God's reign extends over all ages and generations, distinguishing Him as the only eternal King. He alone possesses immortality and is the incorruptible God. Let us praise and admire His infinite wisdom, for He is the source of all grace. The thought of eternity is delightful to believers, as it reminds them of the everlasting nature of God's grace.

To the King, the incorruptible and invisible God, be honor and glory for all eternity. God's reign extends over all ages and generations, distinguishing Him as the only eternal King. He alone possesses immortality and is the incorruptible God. Let us praise and admire His infinite wisdom, for He is the source of all grace. The thought of eternity is delightful to those who are assured of God's grace, as they find solace in the everlasting nature of His reign.

To the eternal King, the incorruptible and invisible God, be everlasting honor and glory. His reign extends over all ages and generations, surpassing any earthly rulers. As the only God, He possesses immortality and is the source of all grace. The thought of eternity is delightful to believers who find solace in the everlasting nature of God's grace. Let us praise Him forever, for He is the King of eternity, reigning with wisdom and righteousness that surpasses all understanding.
